Yes, security guards undergo specific training to develop the discipline and self-control required for their job. The type and level of training vary depending on the security company and the job requirements, but most training programs cover specific topics like:

1. Legal aspects of security
2. Use of force and how to de-escalate conflicts
3. Emergency response procedures
4. Advanced communication and interpersonal skills
5. Basic first aid and CPR training
6. Surveillance techniques
7. Fire safety training, and more.

Additionally, many companies offer ongoing professional development opportunities to ensure that their security staff stays up-to-date with the latest skills and techniques. Through this training and development, security guards are better equipped to maintain professionalism while they interact with the public, making them more effective at their work.
